website_summaries.verdict: Replay or discover the games that laid Nintendo’s foundation like Super Mario Bros. and Metroid with the NES Classic Edition and enjoy its old-school 8-bit charm.
pros: 30 classic NES games, including Kirby’s Adventure, Donkey Kong, and Balloon Fight
Convenient rewind feature for extra help

website_summaries.verdict: Retro gamers will love this trip down memory lane. Not all games have aged well, but it's still worth it for the nostalgia.
pros: Modern updates like HDMI make set-up a snap
Iconic styling brings a blast from the past to any living room
The abundant included games make it a remarkable value
cons: The controllers' only upgrade is compatibility with the Wii and Wii U consoles

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: It was awesome to play the old games again without buying a refurbished NES. The games play and sound the same, so they nailed it. Yes, the controller cord is as short as everyone says, but if you have a long HDMI cable you can get some distance that way, or get a wireless. I have nothing but good things to say about this product.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Workes for 4 month
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome gaming system but it worked for 4 months and then the mother board and power just died. These are not built like the Nintendo's of the old days. That is for sure. Buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: Matthew R.

customer_reviews.title: Non US version
customer_reviews.text: Received a non US version from Bopster USA. BUYER BEWARE IF ORDERING FROM THEM.
customer_reviews.author: dragon813gt

customer_reviews.title: Not working
customer_reviews.text: At first, it worked just fine, but after just 2 weeks of usage it doesn't work right anymore. It will work about once every couple of days for about 15 minutes and then shutdown.
customer_reviews.author: LUPITA

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Product is great. Scalpers suck. I blame Nintendo ultimately though. Apparently they don't like money.
customer_reviews.author: J. Olmstead

customer_reviews.title: Mini version of a classic!
customer_reviews.text: I love the system itself, but my lower rating is based on the fact that this only came with one controller and there are lots of 2 player classics on this system. Also the cords are ridiculously short. In order to really use this system I had to buy another controller and two controller extension cables. Something to keep in mind when purchasing. I do love the system though, tons of great classic Nintendo games that really bring back memories. The system is really small and portable too which I do like as well.
customer_reviews.author: trudancer1

customer_reviews.title: Cheep knock off
customer_reviews.text: Cheep knock off. Don’t waist your money. It says hdmi but there is no place to plug an hdmi cable in to the box.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Bray

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The cords they provided are nearly useless (unless you want to stand a foot away from the TV).
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: So easy to return!
customer_reviews.text: I was actually surprised this was on the Treasure Truck. Quite simply it didn't work. I would've opted for an exchange if not for the power button. The little red light goes on after you push the button 'a couple of times' then it goes off after you push the button 'a couple of more times.' That and the fact that I had hooked it up to two separate televisions and a standalone computer monitor with no result, even after doing some online troubleshooting, told me all I needed to know. The one star is for how easy Amazon made it to return and get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: Don't pay more than $60.....
customer_reviews.text: Got my NES classic ....Love it....but wouldn't pay more than $60 for it...so please wait for the Nintendo to make more...It really ain't worth more than $60 trust me....I am the child who grew up on NES but to my knowledge this console is not worth $200 or what these people are selling online for....please wait til they have more ......you will be regretting paying more than $60 .... Update: so I found out that no more classic nes....heard rumors they will come out with snes for this holiday season so wait til then
customer_reviews.author: H.L.

customer_reviews.title: convenient package that doesn't require any extra fuss is great. Though I have the knowhow to set up ...
customer_reviews.text: My dad introduced me to video games when I was 3 years old with the NES back in the early 90s and I've been a huge Nintendo fan ever since. Being able to get many of those same games in a small, convenient package that doesn't require any extra fuss is great. Though I have the knowhow to set up a Raspberry Pi or other similar system, there's just something very satisfying about a product you can simply plug and play. The games are a great mix, and the whole package looks very sleek.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Solomon

customer_reviews.title: small
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because i liked some of the old nintendo games and wanted to play them again. It should be noted that this can only play the built in games and you cannot use the old cartridge games in it. i wasnt able to find a way to reset this to play a differnet game without hitting the buttons on the actual device (no reboot from crontroller) so every time you want to try another game you need to go back to the console. (not a big deal but worth mentioning). overall it has a good collection of built in games and seems to function like my old origional NES.
customer_reviews.author: Ast

customer_reviews.title: Finnaly
customer_reviews.text: It only took 2-3 years but I finally got one at the original retail price! Great system, great games, great memories. I have another "system" that runs a bunch of emulators and this works better. The games definitely run smoother on the NES Mini than on the other "system". If you, like me, are not satisfied with the selection of games, there are ways to put more on there. A quick google search will give you all the info on this you need. The process is extremely simple and pretty quick, depending on how many games you are adding. Mine is now running about 350 games with zero issues. Yay, nostalgia!
customer_reviews.author: J AndersonTop Contributor: Star Wars

customer_reviews.title: Power cord and saving game data
customer_reviews.text: First off, the micro usb cable it comes with for the power did not work, I had to buy a different micro usb just to turn it on. And for some reason the way they designed the way you save your game progress is just terrible. For the time period this console came it on you would think game data might automatically save, nope. And you can’t override saved data either, saved game data was actually better back in the 80’s when it originally came out. Other than that it’s classic NES nostalgic and fun that’s about it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremie Fox

customer_reviews.title: It can fit in the palm of your hand!
customer_reviews.text: We were one of the lucky ones to purchase one of these. You get a great feeling of nostalgia when you start playing this game. We were yelling at the TV when we couldn't pass a level, and when you lose all your lives, getting that dissapointed feeling of having to start all over (although you can save your place now). The only reason why I dont give it 5 stars is because the cable to the controllers is too short.
customer_reviews.author: SARA

customer_reviews.title: Great system.  Ridiculously short controller cables.
customer_reviews.text: Great fun! I was lucky enough to grab a Nintendo NES Classic Edition on the re-release day, June 29th, and have been playing through all the included games since then. The only problem is that that controller cables are way too short. You really need to buy extension cables in order to play comfortably. Extra controllers are hard to find as well, but they seem to be more available than in the past.
customer_reviews.author: San Diego Sean

customer_reviews.title: Fun NES
customer_reviews.text: An amazing little NES that is easy to set up and works fine. I wished the controller cable was a bit longer as it's really short but the games and hours of fun make this an a very valuable purchase. However, Please don't pay more than 100$ for this wherever you can find it. I got mine from the amazon treasure truck (pretty luckily) and don't think it's worth THAT much more than 60$
customer_reviews.author: MAYANK TRIVEDI

customer_reviews.title: We really enjoy this system
customer_reviews.text: I am so excited to have this game system. It came preloaded with all our favorite games from the original Nintendo which is great! Us and our grandkids have really enjoyed playing this. One small problem is that the controller wire is way to short but we fixed that by getting a two pack of controllers with extenders from another Amazon seller. I am sure you can find that item by looking in my profile at my other reviews I've made. Also, It would be nice if it came with 2 controllers instead of one. That is the only reason I will give it 4 stars instead of 5. Still would buy again though :)
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Power Stopped - Unit Broken
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box the power connection was iffy - you had to wiggle and adjust the cable and unit just so until it turned and stayed on. It was fun playing for a few weeks. Then a few weeks ago the power simply cut out mid-game, and the unit refuses to turn on no matter what I do. Effectively, this thing is cheap trash that will break easily. I'm going to see if some local repair person can fix it, but I can't in good faith recommend spending money on this, when you can easily play these games elsewhere and more reliably. As it stands now, this is not worth buying. Period.
customer_reviews.author: RSKrules

customer_reviews.title: Great flash from the past - some caveats
customer_reviews.text: The product worked right out of the box. That being said, I had to sit on the floor 3 feet from the television in order to play it, because the controller cable is laughably short. They make extension cables for the controller that are sold separately, remember to buy the extension cable. There are also online instructions for modding the console so that you can add games to it. In my instance I was successful at adding Rygar, Rush-N-Attack, and Kung Fu to my console without any issues, using referenced instructions. Its a great way to reminisce of the old days and also make your kids grateful they have a PS4.
customer_reviews.author: GregH

customer_reviews.title: Finally got an NES Classic for retail price!
customer_reviews.text: This is splendid just from a sheer novelty value whether you are like me and wasn't born during the era of NES or just love the nostalgic appeal of it all. 30 games loaded into the system with save states, filter types, and 720p HD graphics for sharper pixel perception it is quite a steal at $59.99 retail. I would recommend it to anyone before they sell out again!
customer_reviews.author: Metragoon

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, get a Raspberry Pi!!
customer_reviews.text: Its awesome to play the games i had as a kid again! Only problem I notice is a bit of input lag. While most this might not bother, it just doesn't "feel" right and hinders my abilities compared to playing nes games on an original NES console. Update (9-10-2019): I bought a Raspberry Pi 3 B+ for Retro Gaming and OMG it blows this POS out of the water! Its easy to find games (ROMS) and you can play many different consoles on it. If you know about gaming on a Raspberry Pi then you know that it already IS the better choice then ALL these "classic" consoles coming out lately.
customer_reviews.author: 3tch3r

customer_reviews.title: Good Old Fun from Days Gone By!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an exceptional product which delivers what the buyer is after: Good Old Fun from Days Gone By!!! This Entertainment System works extremely well and provides very welcome stress relief! I am having a ton of fun playing Legend of Zelda, and that game alone is worth the purchase price. Eventually I MIGHT get around to playing some of the other classic games. The old-school 1980's style controller is a blast! Strongly recommend that the add-on wireless controller be purchased to eliminate the "hassle factor" with controller wires. Have Fun!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Seeker707

customer_reviews.title: Father/son bonding
customer_reviews.text: My 12-year-old son loves the new video games, but I can't really play with him. Too much to learn and I don't have that kind of time to spend on video games. FINALLY there is a video game we can play together and be on equal footing. You'll have fun reliving all the games you played as a kid, while showing your kids the way we did it back in the day. My son gets a kick out of it and can't believe I was once good at video games. However, no he knows because I've been dominating that little punk at Donkey Kong!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The cable sucks (length), but I just replaced it with a ...
customer_reviews.text: this machine just takes me back! Lovin' every minute of game time! The cable sucks (length), but I just replaced it with a wireless NES30 controller. Don't recommend that, 'cause the two bluetooth receivers conflict, rendering them useless. So, I finally (today) replaced the short and wireless pads with a 12ft "wired" version. Working GREAT on all fronts now! To bad the price was SO marked up. :|
customer_reviews.author: tc

customer_reviews.title: Old games all in one cute little mini nintendo package
customer_reviews.text: If you want a true old school feel when you’re playing old school games, sit on the floor with your neck tipped back and play with the wired controller. If you want to see your chiropractor leas often, spring for the wireless controllers available from genius sellers on Amazon. Good selection of games, though I personally played the SNES games more, and still do. Worth it for a little nostalgia.
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, but it would be better with 2 controllers...
customer_reviews.text: Love this product... if mostly for nostalgia. This unit inexpensively allowed my wife and I to give our kids a classical video game education. She and I have also happily dueled across many games from our childhoods. The NES classic only comes with a single controller - which is a huge annoyance. Note - when you order another controller on Amazon, make sure you also order some controller cable extensions. You don’t want to have to sit 4’ from the TV.
customer_reviews.author: GO BUCKEYES

customer_reviews.title: We love the games on here!
customer_reviews.text: Not for sure if it's our wireless remote controller we got or the system itself, but there seems to be a lag that it doesn't respond to the timing of when you click on the controls to when it pops up on the screen when you jump, walk, pretty much anything. It's a small lag, but being a beta tester for quite some time, just an observation. No biggie. Other than that ONLY thing this system is the bomb.com! Not kidding fun for the ENTIRE family!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Bellemore

customer_reviews.title: It's great... There is a catch though
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I love that the USB port on my TV is capable of powering it. There's a ton of great games and the controllers are exactly the same as the original NES controller. I'm taking away one star because the cord for the controller is insanely short. It's basically not usable out of the box. You'll need an extension cord. I don't get what they were thinking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One controller with short cord
customer_reviews.text: While I have not plugged this in and seen the game quality I am thoroughly disappointed that it only comes with one controller, let alone only 3 ft long cord. After a quick search I found extensions for the controller, $11, and an additional controller for $35. This nearly doubled the purchase price of the original product. So be aware. I am sure all this info is in the description and my fault but still disappointed, who wants to play this alone?...
customer_reviews.author: jh

customer_reviews.title: Blast from the past, super fun
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - NES 8 bit classics - small form factor console - classic controllers - it’s Nintendo. Cons: - very short controller cables - you have to hit the reset button to save (making you exit the game to save). Would be nice if you can just hold start or some other button combo to save while in the game. - could be a little cheaper, price point is a little too high IMO Overall: Awesome product & very happy with my purchase. Couch masters like myself may get annoyed with having to hit the reset button but that’s the only reason it didn’t get 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kernel Panic

customer_reviews.title: It's back in stock after a year and a half
customer_reviews.text: It is finally back in stock. Nintendo really mis-handled the initial release. I vowed I was not going to pay more that $60 and I am glad I waited. The graphics are good and true to the original games. Just remember to buy an extension for your controller. The one that comes in the box is only 4 feet. Adding a 10' cord makes it so you don't need to sit right in front of the TV. I look forward to many hours of enjoyment.
customer_reviews.author: paksiegurlie

customer_reviews.title: Just like the original. A few hiccups, but fun nonetheless.
customer_reviews.text: Love this! It’s got a decent amount of games and place exactly as I remember it. Note to development team: please double the length of the controllers. I had to spend another $10 for extension cables. A second controller would be great, even for another $10 added to the MSRP. I hate having to buy an OEM second remote, so why not steal their business back? Another note to developers: iPhone controllers would make this a dream. This only comes with ONE controller, so be sure to buy a generic second controller or you’ll be playing solo day 1. Anyway, totally worth what I paid. Nothing better than zoning out to a game, rather than the same old nightly news!
customer_reviews.author: Riley Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Needs an adapter?
customer_reviews.text: After inquiring in the comments section if this System would work on my computer instead of a TV and being assured it would work; sadly, it doesn't. I even bought an additional HDMI cord because I wasn't certain one would be included in the package (it was). Some of the images show a "USB power adapter included provides 5.2V at 1amp." My carton was much too small to have that included. So now I am ordering an adapter. Hopefully, that will make it work. I'll edit this comment if the adapter makes the game work.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice System.  Nintendo needs to add more games.
customer_reviews.text: Reminds me of my childhood. Punch out is on this system but it is not Mike Tyson Punch out. I hope Nintendo will add official Mods to add more games. The 8bitdo wireless controllers are a must have. The controller wires are too short. The graphic are terrible compared to today's standards but, this is what we grew up on. The play-ability of the games are still fun and exciting today. I have this system and the SNES Classic. I play these more that my Xbox Scorpio.
customer_reviews.author: David W

customer_reviews.title: NES Classic Edition is GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I plugged this NES Classic into my power outlet with the included power cord and plug and then use the HDMI cord that is also included and plug one end to the NES Classic and the other end of the HDMI cable to my TV. You navigate the Menu with your Classic Controller and when you are playing a game you just press the reset button to go back to the main menu to play a different game. Easy to use and Great. Brings back old memories. Included Items are the NES Classic Edition, one Classic Controller, one power cord with the USB plug, and a HDMI cable.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Albee

customer_reviews.title: A nice little bit of Nestaligia.
customer_reviews.text: A cool little idea that I'm glad worked out for Nintendo. It's got most of the games that I would want on a NES and the little controllers are pretty cute. I think my only real problem is that the cords on the controller are super short, 3 feet I believe. I end up having to sit super close to the TV if I want to play it, which isn't exactly what I wanted. I think they sell extension cords so it's not a deal breaker, but still something to keep in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Hatt

customer_reviews.title: Impress Your Children
customer_reviews.text: My kids do not do a lot of gaming, as they have limits to how much screen time they get. But this was a gaming system the whole family could enjoy. The parents get to impress with their in-depth knowledge of classic games, and the kids get acquainted with famous characters and games from the past. My only complaint would be that the controller cables could be a bit longer, but I haven't even researched extension cables, so I must not mind that much.
customer_reviews.author: J. Conradt

customer_reviews.title: It’s amazing
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement Christmas gift when the original gift (Atari Flashback) had too many glitches. First, this thing is over priced, however it is not available in the US market and what your are buying is an imported version from the UK or Russia. Do not fear, it works amazingly and everything is in English except the packaging. I think this adds to the charm. Nintendo is missing out on a huge opportunity in the US market, because we are suckers. Also get some extenders for the controllers as the one provided is super short.
customer_reviews.author: DRDJ

customer_reviews.title: Just like old times!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband's b-day and he and I and our kids are obsessed. It is so nostalgic with all the games we loved as kids and none of the blowing in the cartridge to make it work. My one complaint is it only comes with one controller and the cord is very short. I attempted to buy a second controller but got one that doesn't fit in the port. I still have to figure that one out but overall this was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Boca Girl

customer_reviews.title: NE-YES!! Definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The NES System I purchased off of amazon is one of the best gaming systems I have used in a long time. The retro games are very accurate and bring me back to good times. I use the system daily, and would highly recommend others to purchase. The system is also very portable, so if you are on the move frequently, this is the gaming system for you
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: This thing is BOSS
customer_reviews.text: If you played these games as kid then you will likely enjoy playing them again as an adult -- great nostalgia. I would recommend ordering an extra controller if you plan on playing any 2 player games. Otherwise, you have to switch the controller input each time it is the other person's turn. Some people are saying they got foreign versions of the system and are having trouble. I was concerned about that, but this is definitely the US version and we are enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan & Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Husband Loves It
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my husband, and he was so excited when he opened it. We have it set up in the living room and have really enjoyed re-living parts of our childhoods while playing the games. The only reason I don't give 5 stars is that there is no way to download additional games, it's just play as-is. A lot of great games come already on it, but considering technological era that we're living in, it seems silly to me not to have a way to at least pay for additional games to download.
customer_reviews.author: Karen B.

customer_reviews.title: it is what it says that it is!
customer_reviews.text: I wish it was the original, fairer $50 price tag. I wish it came with a second controller. And, I wish it had the power adapter. Oh, and for sure more games, the Switch now has classic hockey and super dodge ball etc... sooooo good! lol. But you get what the description says along with a great dose of nostalgic game-play. If you're looking for what is in the description, and it is worth the price for you? Then enjoy my friend, there are hours of fun times ahead for you!
customer_reviews.author: Bmacker

customer_reviews.title: overall great
customer_reviews.text: works great and fun to play all these main games again...but the save feature is very annoying as far as having to get up and hit the reset button each time for it or if you just want to go back to the main menu..... wish they would have put a menu button on the controller to get back to the main menu and would have just let you save the game within the games by pushing the start button and just clicking on save game or something
customer_reviews.author: Chris Nice

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever for the child at heart.
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this. The minute I plugged it in, my childhood (the better parts of it) came sweeping in and I was 5 or 6 again. Well, I still have my first original Nintendo. But this tiny little machine is just a great tour de force given the quantity of games AND the ability to SAVE!!! Highly recommend this for any geek, gamer or collector of all things tech, nerd/geek, nostalgia. Worth every penny. (Thoigh I feel bad for those forking out 400$ lol). My only complaint is the controller cord and the power cord are really short. But they do offer a wireless controller
customer_reviews.author: ryan goimarac

customer_reviews.title: Great for little kids
customer_reviews.text: It is sooo tiny compared to the original! Super light and easy to navigate. My 4 year old granddaughter has already learned how to reset and look for a different game. The only down side is that it seems to lag at turning on sometimes and the controllers are very short. I did buy the extended ones immediately so that worked better
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy a wireless controller
customer_reviews.text: This console is TINY. It fits in the palm of my hand. Its exactly as expected except for one major flaw, the controller. You NEED a wireless controller. The controller that comes with it has the shortest cord ever. Its about 2.5 -3 ft and there is no possibility of comfort when using a controller with a cord that short. If you plan on having two players, buy two wireless controllers. It was highly amusing to see 8 bit games on the TV again. The games are exactly as remembered. (Everything is right where it should be in FF and Zelda)
customer_reviews.author: BeccaTop Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: So small and perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have not played this but a couple of times but from what I have seen it is just like the original version. I love that there are so many games installed and that you don't have to worry about purchasing game cartridges. This one only came with one controller but I purchased a second one for just a few dollars. You will also want to purchase the extensions for the controllers. The cord on it is not very long. I also love that it is so small. It fits right in front of out TV on the stand without being a nuisance.
customer_reviews.author: jshiver

customer_reviews.title: So much fun & great price!!!
customer_reviews.text: God bless you Amazon for having this back on sale and for SO FREAKING CHEAP. It brings back so many memories as a 9 year old when my Grandmother saved up all year to buy me the original system in 1989. My now 6 year old son loves playing this with me. I actually bought him a Nintendo Switch for Christmas and he prefers to play this. He has picked up his Switch to play it about 15 times since Christmas. He asks me almost daily to play this old school Nintendo with him!!!??? Zelda is our favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Benjy Bronk

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but not really playable...
customer_reviews.text: The console is cute and includes some of the best classic Nintendo titles, but that is where the nostalgia ends. The cord length for the controller is absurdly short, plus the lag on the controllers makes anything other than a quick trip down memory lane infeasible. Playing any of these classic games quickly became frustrating. The game pad is smaller than the originals and the buttons lack enough sensitivity to be practical.
customer_reviews.author: T.Kobus

customer_reviews.title: Feels like old times!
customer_reviews.text: Takes me back to being young again! Games are great, easy to hook up. I will say that the controller cord is very short so I suggest buying a extension. The only other thing I dont like is that you can't save any game so you have to just either leave it on or start over which can be a pain if you've gotten pretty far in a game.
customer_reviews.author: Cmy25

customer_reviews.title: Nintendo is a great gift!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson (age 6) and he loves it. It is a small system as all 30 games included are digital unlike the Nintendo his Dad used in the late 80's or early 90's that came with 2 games. (and you paid a lot for the other game cartridges.) E purchased an additional remot so he could play games on it with a friend, parent or his brother. Very easy set up.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene Hall

customer_reviews.title: Temporarily fun
customer_reviews.text: Finally got one only to find that it's fun for about one hour before you stuff it in a closet. I sucked at these games when I was 9 and I suck at them now. These games are extremely difficult, for the simple fact they they're short. Buy an extension cord for the controller, trust me, the included one is only about 2 feet long. I'll probably end up selling this to someone. Difficult games just aren't fun these days.
customer_reviews.author: MikeFrett

customer_reviews.title: Cords are waaaay too short!!
customer_reviews.text: Cords are waaaaaaay too short. Waaaaaay too short. No power cord included. Game save states are 4 per applicable game...which is great. But sitting 3 feet from the tv is terrible. Best way to use the console is on a pc/laptop with an HDMI in port. Overall good gaming experience.
customer_reviews.author: Jake McKay

customer_reviews.title: THE FIRSTTHING I REMEMBER ABOUT THE UNITED STATES
customer_reviews.text: WAS GOING OVER TO JIMMY AND BRIAN'S HOUSE AND PLAYING DUCK HUNT. THIS DOES NOT HAVE DUCK HUNT. BUT IT'S TINY. SO. I DON'T THINK THEY COULD DO A TINY GUN. THEY NEED A TINY GUN FOR DUCK HUNT. OR MAYBE I BET DUCK HUNT IS AVAILABLE ELSEWHERE THEREFORE THE FIVE STARS. I FORGOT HOW HARD IT IS TO BE OLD SCHOOL BUT I AM SURE IT HELPS MY MOTOR SKILLS AS IT DID WHEN I WAS A CHILDREN
customer_reviews.author: SHAWNANANANANANANANANANNEEENEEE

customer_reviews.title: I mistakenly gave a poor review
customer_reviews.text: I meant a previous negative review to go to a different seller (face masks) and mistakenly placed it on this seller. The product and delivery for this item was 5 star. My apologizes to the seller. I'm not sure how to remove the poor post, but I will if I can. Again, this is a 5 STAR seller. My grand daughter and her mother are enjoying the "old school" Nintendo games together in this stay at home virus nonsense.
customer_reviews.author: DW Hill, Author of The ATOMICAS Series superhero books

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the whole family...again
customer_reviews.text: Great entertainment value! I almost shed a tear playing Super Mario 3 on the big screen again. It even brought my basement dwelling teen son up for some quality time beating Bowser together (which is soo much easier when you can save the game). My 7 & 8 year old girls have thoroughly enjoyed the games too. Though now I know what my parents had to deal with trying to pry me away from it.
customer_reviews.author: Kim M

customer_reviews.title: Ehh cool for about 10 minutes
customer_reviews.text: This console had a lot of games that were a blast from the past. However, there seems to be a delay which makes it hard to get the hang of it. Also, with the throwback controller, it leaves little navigation options to go back to the menu or make selections. Given the chance, I wouldn't purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: iLoveMySailor!

customer_reviews.title: Best Throwback Box
customer_reviews.text: I know these games are old, but they are the ones I grew up with. The plug and controller wires are SHORT. I would highly recommend the extension cables, or wireless controllers. I have found the off brand wireless controllers to be laggy, but work ok. I use an extension cable when I play. Overall i'm so glad I was able to get this. I'll probably force my children to use this as their starter system if they wan't to learn about the good ole days of gaming.
customer_reviews.author: M FN K

customer_reviews.title: NOt The NES CLASSIC EDITION
customer_reviews.text: Pictures and descriptions are misleading. Pictures of what I got. International version I think. Not the NES CLASSIC EDITION.
customer_reviews.author: LEE

customer_reviews.title: Yay! It has been released again!
customer_reviews.text: Whoever is responsible for getting this released again...thank you! I was fortunate enough to get one during the first release a couple years ago and have had so much fun with it. My children, who now live away from home, kept trying to convince me to let them take it to their homes. No way....I would never get it back. Now that it has been released once again, I now have bought them each their own. Graphics and sound are great...would recommend purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Brock68

customer_reviews.title: Money grab junk with one controller
customer_reviews.text: Cheap to make, cheaper to put games on. A jumped up usb drive with old games... SO WHY ONLY ONE CONTROLLER? Thanks for being consistently greedy, that is the only thing that is dependable about money grabbing companies. One controller with a short bs cord. Total crap. Have to buy the second controller and cord extensions. Returning this and just using an emulator on pc. Screw this junk
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Great system, controller cord way too short
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for the reasonable price of $59.99. I have really enjoyed this so far, great choice of games. My only complaint is that the controller cord is less than three feet long so I had to order extension cables because I dont want my kids standing that close to the tv and neither do I.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: This is a BOOTLEG system. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: Was so excited to have picked this up as a birthday gift for my wife. After playing it for not too long, we began to notice that it was a bit glitchy, would freeze up from time to time, and the game save functions don’t work. After looking into it further, the serial number on the product is not legit. So, it is a verified bootleg system. TOTAL false advertisement. So f’ing pissed about this. Spent over $200 and expected to receive the real thing which worked as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Countryman

customer_reviews.title: Lemons
customer_reviews.text: For 60 bucks it averages out at 2$ a game. The paddle cord is literally 2 feet long which will either need an extension or DYI method, inside the cord is four 26 gauge braided conductors, color coded. The unit itself has a game save method by pressing reset then adding a saved game up to 4 slots. However none of this works if you decide to save more than 1 game at a time.
customer_reviews.author: PureEnergy

customer_reviews.title: Best emulation of NES games.
customer_reviews.text: Sure a Raspberry Pi with an NES emulator is a lot cheaper but it's easier to trust the company who made the original hardware to deliver a quality mini version of it. Nintendo knocks it out of the park with this. I wouldn't buy it for 100 dollars though.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Nostalgia
customer_reviews.text: This is great for nostalgia. Brings back 90s memories, especially Mario Brothers. It’s amazing how one remembers where the secret bricks are even after 30 years. Just plug and play, couldn’t be easier. It only comes with one controller so we bought another one, but honestly you don’t need it. I don’t believe there are games that allow two players to play at once so you have to take turns anyway. Just unplug from player one and plug into player two. It’s an extra step but it’s a way to avoid buying another controller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't pay more than the $59.99 MSRP
customer_reviews.text: I paitently waited to buy one at retail price. When it was finally rerelesed 2 years later I finally did thanks to Amazon Prime's lightning deal. Just like everyone else, my dislike is the short controller cord. If you are trying to get one for yourself, still, you might want to get the Switch instead and get the online service so you can play NES games there. This was meant for gamers who did not experience the NES. Honestly, I play my PS4 and Switch more and often forget I have this.... Just keep that in mind if you still want one.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful nostalgic mini console
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Nintendo Classic mini that was for friend's birthday gift as I already own one for myself. This is no words needed. Great and just great except the tiny length of cable for the controller. It brings a good fond memories of my childhood staying overnight playing with my brother. Perfect size to carry around and most of all, it was only $59.99 plus tax as it should be. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kim

customer_reviews.title: Love Nintendo as a kid try this
customer_reviews.text: Love it all the old games, and can actually save the game start where you left off. Controller cords are really short, i would recommend buy an extension cord for the controller and it only comes with one controller.
customer_reviews.author: Chris cadwallader

customer_reviews.title: ❤️❤️❤️ (full heart containers)
customer_reviews.text: Major reminiscing with this item! I went through and saved the princess of Zelda in 48 hours. There are a bunch of games on here but I wish it had the capability to download or buy other games because obviously not all the NES games are featured. Kung Fu & Contra come to mind. Seriously worth the money though, my brother and I had some great conversations about it and really warped me back to being 11 years old again. Quite an experience!
customer_reviews.author: tuffinator77

customer_reviews.title: Retro done right! But add the additions please.
customer_reviews.text: Who knew it was so easy to thrill a 40-year old?! Ordered an extra controller and control extensions as recommended by others—both are a must have! Why the original does not come w these is beyond me. My kids and husband have been enjoying these old games so much. No regrets here expect possibly not getting it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Trin

customer_reviews.title: YEESSSSS!!!
customer_reviews.text: SUPER FUN!! Wish it had just a few more games on there.....especially the original Contra! Only wanted to less a half star but I couldn't.....and that was because of the controller. The one that comes with it, the cord is super super short!! And it seems the plus pad/directional is wearing out already, and we've only had it for like 2 mths!! I bought one on here for a spare (I think is was $10?) and the cord is waay long which is nice. Overall pretty cool though! I love playing on it! Brings me back ya know?!? Taught my kid about Mario!!!! LOL
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Worlds shortest controller cords
customer_reviews.text: Includes everything you need to play NES classics 2 feet from the TV. I'm glad they made the SNES controller cords longer and included the rewind feature. While these aren't much more than a retro pie in a nostalgic package, I really have enjoyed all the classic consoles with the original controllers. SNES is the best system but if you really like the original classics and dont want to much around with x, y, and shoulder buttons, this is your machine.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin H. Mossberg

customer_reviews.title: So fun! Order 12ft cord controllers!
customer_reviews.text: This brings me back for sure! Super Mario Bro 3 is my jam!! We never play video games but during this corona virus quarantine it’s made things much more enjoyable! Definitely order yourselves a couple 12ft cords along with it!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Thanks Treasure Truck!
customer_reviews.text: Managed to pick one of these up through Amazon's Treasure Truck last weekend. I love it! Its adorable, and has 30 classic games on it. Just what I expected! No complaints! I highly suggest everyone waits to purchase it for the retail $60 and not a penny more. That's just too much. Be patient!
customer_reviews.author: saranoh

customer_reviews.title: Building memories with the next generation.
customer_reviews.text: I waited for 5:15AM PDT on June 29th 2018. Amazon had a lightning sale and I managed to snag one. Nintendo has promised to stock more. So do not pay the scalpers. Just buy it was MSRP. The original Legend of Zelda came out when I was 7. My oldest son is now 7. We just spent the last two hours playing LoZ together. So much fun and so many memories. We also play Breath of the Wild together. Both Zelda games are our favorites to play.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J. Riegerix II

customer_reviews.title: What's not to like?  But controller cord is too short.  Saving games is awkward.
customer_reviews.text: I won't go into all the good things about this little honey, I'm sure those are obvious. But I will point out that the controller cord is insultingly short. You basically have to play with the console on your lap. It's a joke. Buy an extension or wireless controller. And, saving game progress is a little awkward. You need to press the Reset button on the unit to save, so you have to get up and walk over to the unit when you want to save. Not the end of the world but odd and inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: ptatohed

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! Short Controller Cables!
customer_reviews.text: The overall build quality for this thing is great! The biggest issue is the length of the cables for the controllers. I ended up buying extension cables for this. A lot of the Bluetooth controller options add latency and make games that require perfect timing impossible to play. Modding this is very easy, and you can add an OTG USB adapter and drive to increase the space on this too!
customer_reviews.author: Duylinh Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Shameful Re-Release
customer_reviews.text: yes loaded with 30 games, of which I only played probably 5 of them when I was a kid. Could of had the best ones built in... whoever was in charge of the adding the games to this console should be fired... and also fire the scumbag who thought it would be an excellent idea to have the controller chord 3inches long (that’s what it feels like)
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Brings you right back to your childhood!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for Christmas for my son, but mom was the first to try it! It’s so fun and brings me back to my childhood! It’s very small and can easily be moved around or traveled with. Only thing I did not notice, is it only cones with one controller. Also the cord is very short on this controller. I plan to order two more controllers with longer cords.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Marie Jedinak

customer_reviews.title: So much fun, but only one controller?
customer_reviews.text: This is so much fun to play. Makes me feel like I'm a kid again. I've had this for a few weeks and have played a few times. My one complaint is that is only comes with one controller - that's why I gave it 4 stars. The SNES classic comes with two. I went ahead and purchased a second so I can play with someone. I also purchased the controller extension cables, as these are very short unless you're sitting super close to the TV. Overall, I'm happy. Again, my only complaint is that this only comes with a single controller. If I experience any technical difficulties I'll update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Retro play
customer_reviews.text: Well just received and set it up. The box is small and product well protected. Set up is simple. Only thing missing is a second controller and you must provide your own plug to put usb into for power. The system works great and was able to play games in no time. One other issue I noticed is the cord for the controller is extremely short. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Blackdoghoxie

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed as my HDMI switcher does not recognize PAL format
customer_reviews.text: Received the European PAL version instead of the North American NTSC version as advertised in the listing. Very disappointed as my HDMI switcher does not recognize PAL format. Payed nearly 4 times the MSRP for this. Buyer Beware.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Rynsky

customer_reviews.title: For fans and collectors
customer_reviews.text: The chord length for the control is only 3 feet long and there's no home button for returning to the selection menu. I remedied this by buying and aftermarket wireless control with a home button. Great to play some of my favorite old games again. Wish there were a lot more on it, but I understand why there isn't. Great for nostalgia.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Fontenot

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Legit Nintendo gaming system, not like the knockoffs our there (& there are plenty). Husband & I are having a blast reliving our youths with this & are very happy with the purchase. Wish it came with 2 remotes & the cords were a bit longer but that’s no fault of the seller & is more on Nintendo themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony/Valerie

customer_reviews.title: memories
customer_reviews.text: I remember buying one of the first original Nintendo machines when my kids were younger, I too had my fun playing also, when I saw this retro Nintendo, I had to have one. Hubby and I a very pleased playing the old games....and no kids at home to fight for the machine.😀
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Ruby
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift thinking it was the new one coming out in September, even though it is not the person really loves this one, I am having fun watching and playing this as well, it is said to be limited, even though the "new" one has an extra game we must remember a gem is a gem ruby is still shining while everybody wants the diamonds.
customer_reviews.author: Binka Emor

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but the controllers suck.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this NES! I only wish it had the original Contra game, not the terrible sequel. The controllers feel authentic and well made but we only used them once. The cord seems comically short. We had to buy wireless controllers (cheaper than cable extensions) just to play the games. Trying to play on our 60" TV, you only sit 3 feet away from the screen which is a headache. Overall we are very pleased and would buy again if lost or damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F. Crisman

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun, but buy yourself some cables!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little device that brought back a ton of memories! I love it! However, you'll need to dig through your junk drawers and hope that you have some compatible cables. Not sure what Nintendo was thinking, but the included HDMI cable is only 15 inches long and the power cable is LESS than 1 foot long. Not sure who in the world has a TV setup where such short cable will work. Once it's set up though, it's well worth the cable-caused headache!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Freidenberg

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Plug in and play, works perfect with no lag! Only downside is only one remote and the remote cord is super short, however you can purchase extending ones and workes great! I still play my original Nintendo, it’s just nice to be able to hit a button without fiddling for 5 minutes, crossing your fingers a certain game will work, or won’t quit suddenly when some one sneezes;) love it! Bought multiple for family members!
customer_reviews.author: TheMrs.

customer_reviews.title: it would be been nice to know that info as I now need to ...
customer_reviews.text: I just got my NES Classic, and I wish I could play it, but it's the European version (not as advertised) so now I need to order an AC adapter as it's not included. I paid the scalper' s prices mind you (which is cheaper on listings that offer the European version. For the price, it would be been nice to know that info as I now need to order and wait for the AC adapter.
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: I was psyched to get my niece and nephew this ...
customer_reviews.text: I was psyched to get my niece and nephew this, and sure enough it worked and they were totally in to it... but the jump button (A) was totally delayed. Everything else works as expected, but whether I was using the controller that came with the game, or the bluetooth controllers I also purchased, that one button was on a one second delay, which made it really frustrating to play.
customer_reviews.author: Rehana Ashraf

customer_reviews.title: Great family fun.
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great addition to our gaming collection. My girls have loved seeing the games I grew up playing. It only comes with ONE controller. Word of caution: be careful when buying controllers even on Amazon. We have bought a couple that were duds. We then ended up going to Gamestop in order to get a quality one that I know would work.
customer_reviews.author: JPH

customer_reviews.title: Awesome... DUH!
customer_reviews.text: I mean honestly, there's not much else to say except this thing is AWESOMEEEE. It's such a hit for our friends and family, even the younger generation! We love playing on this thing and it came in clutch during this quarantine. 4-stars only because I don't really play all of the games and wish there were more.
customer_reviews.author: Jilly P

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth the wait
customer_reviews.text: It took a long time, but it was worth the wait. The little thing takes me back to my youth and makes me feel young again. Mario is still great, and there are so many games I didn't have as a kid that I am now playing. No excuse for Nintendo not making enough of these little gems. Worth $60 easily. I wasn't going to pay the scalper price. If you can get it used, I wouldn't pay more than 60 to 70 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: G G

customer_reviews.title: Very  small  but  a  whole  lot  of  fun
customer_reviews.text: I like how small it is and with all the games pre-loaded this was worth the price I paid for. Absolutely love it. My particular favorite is The Legend of Zelda. I haven't played it in more than 25 years. I never had the chance to finish it but now I have the chance. :)
customer_reviews.author: Staceybrowne

customer_reviews.title: Revisit your childhood
customer_reviews.text: This is a really fun console. We spent hours revisiting all our old favorite games like Dr. Mario and Punch Out. My only complaint about the system is that the cord on the controller is too short. We had to sit almost on top of the TV. A longer cord would have been a five star review for sure. Even with that I still recommend this game console for hours of nostalgic fun.
customer_reviews.author: Jess R.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful system!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I love this! The system quality is fantastic and we have system we bought from a different seller and the picture is poor quality. Classic games are plentiful, which my husband is a huge Zelda fan so he was very pleased. Highly recommend to anyone who wants to purchase this. Only 4 stars due to coming with one controller and the cord is not too lengthy. Going to be looking into the wireless controllers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Nintendo Entertainment System: NES Classic Edition
product_meta.description:
From your first Goomba stomp to your thousandth victory in Final Fantasy, the Nintendo Entertainment System may just be the most nostalgic gaming console ever. And now, a new, miniaturized version is here, pre-loaded with 30 of the all-time greatest games, including The Legend of Zelda, Super Mario Bros. 3, and Mega Man 2. Just plug it in…and play. 

Ideal for collectors or anyone who enjoys video games, the Nintendo Entertainment System: NES Classic Edition lets you live out the good old days of gaming like never before. The system comes bundled with an HDMI cable, an AC adapter, one NES Classic Controller, and all 30 games, installed and ready-to-play. The system is also compatible with the Classic Controller and Classic Controller Pro, but additional NES Classic Controllers will be sold separately. Each NES Classic Controller can be plugged into a Wii Remote controller for use with NES Virtual Console games on the Wii U system Return to your roots…or discover them for the first time. The wonderful world of 8-bit awaits.Data Storage Drive Capacity: No built-in storage
feature_bullets: The Nintendo Entertainment System: NES Classic Edition has the original look and feel, only smaller, sleeker, and pre loaded with 30 games
The pre installed games include: Super Mario Bros., Donkey Kong, The Legend of Zelda, PAC MAN, Dr. Mario, Mega Man, Final Fantasy, and dozens more
Comes with one old school, grey colored NES Classic Controller and an AC adapter
Also compatible with Classic Controller and Classic Controller Pro. Additional NES Classic Controllers will be sold separately

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars6,437 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
